g.text: and (311) crystal planes (JCPDS 19-0191) of the zinc blende
cubic crystal structure of CdSe. The indicated diﬀraction signals
at the top represent the respective
zinc blende cubic crystal structure of ZnS. Note that the
diﬀraction signals of the quantumdots prepared in this work are
the standard diﬀraction signals of CdSe and ZnS, the CdSe/ZnS
diﬀraction peaks slightly shifted from smaller angles (corre-
sponding to the CdSe crystal) to larger angles (corresponding to
the ZnS crystal). This implies that the synthesized quantumdots
demonstrates a picture of synthesized quantum dots
irradiated by sun light and green (532 nm) and red (628 nm)
light emission excited by ultraviolet light. As shown in
visible spectra were measured using toluene as the
background and then the synthesized quantum dots were
diluted in toluene to measure the corresponding absorption
b shows the ﬂuorescence spectra of the
synthesized CdSe/ZnS excited at a wavelength of 440 nm,
exhibiting that the peak positions of CdSe/ZnS are present at
532 and 628 nm with full width at half maximum (FWHM) of
28, respectively, corresponding to green and red emitting light.
Note that a plurality of exciton peaks appears in the UV
visible spectra (a) and PL spectra of CdSe/ZnS quantum dots (b).
Cross-sectional EDS mapping of the green and red-mixed CdSe/ZnS (0.1 wt %) quantum dot
